math-p1-1.title: Numbers 1–20
math-p1-1.subject: Mathematics
math-p1-1.content: In this topic, pupils learn how to count numbers from 1 to 20 in the correct order. They practice writing numbers and identifying them in real-life objects such as toys, fruits, and classroom items.
examples: Write numbers from 1–20 in your exercise book.
Circle number 12 on the number chart.

math-p1-2.title: Basic Shapes
math-p1-2.subject: Mathematics
math-p1-2.content: Students are introduced to common shapes such as circle, square, rectangle, and triangle. They learn how to recognize shapes in their environment.
examples: A slice of bread is a square.

eng-p1-1.title: Alphabet and Phonics
eng-p1-1.subject: English
eng-p1-1.content: Pupils learn the 26 letters of the alphabet and their sounds. This builds the foundation for reading and writing.
examples: C makes the 'k' sound like in Cat.

eng-p1-2.title: Simple Words
eng-p1-2.subject: English
eng-p1-2.content: Children are introduced to 2–3 letter words they can easily read and write.

sci-p1-1.title: Living and Non-Living Things
sci-p1-1.subject: Basic Science
sci-p1-1.content: Students learn the difference between things that are alive and things that are not. Living things can move, grow, and reproduce, while non-living things cannot.

sci-p1-2.title: Parts of the Body
sci-p1-2.subject: Basic Science
sci-p1-2.content: Children identify major parts of the body and their uses.

soc-p1-1.title: My Family
soc-p1-1.subject: Social Studies
soc-p1-1.content: Pupils learn about different family members and their roles.

soc-p1-2.title: My School
soc-p1-2.subject: Social Studies
soc-p1-2.content: Students are introduced to their school environment and its importance.
examples: A classroom is where we learn.

com-p1-1.title: Parts of a Computer
com-p1-1.subject: Computer Studies
com-p1-1.content: Children learn to identify computer parts such as monitor, keyboard, mouse, and CPU.
examples: The monitor shows pictures and text.
The mouse helps to move the pointer.
The keyboard is used to type.

com-p1-2.title: Turning On and Off a Computer
com-p1-2.subject: Computer Studies
com-p1-2.content: Students are taught how to properly turn on and shut down a computer.
examples: Press the power button to turn on.
